SEARCH
Package com.example.app

Class HomeController

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.VBox
com.example.app.HomeController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class HomeController extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox
Provides the main cashier interface for managing bubble tea orders.

This controller handles the complete order workflow including drink selection, customization (ice level, sweetness, milk type), topping selection, order display, and payment processing. It manages UI components for multiple drink categories (Milk Tea, Fruit Tea, Blended, Seasonal) and provides real-time order tracking.

Features:
  • Multi-category drink selection with dynamic menu loading from database
  • Customizable drink options (ice, sweetness, milk type)
  • Multi-select topping system with price calculation
  • Real-time order summary with running total
  • Complete checkout flow with cash/card payment options
  • Database integration for order persistence
  • Order history synchronization
Example usage: 
     HomeController home = new HomeController();
     home.setDatabaseService(dbService);
     home.setEmployeeName("John Doe");
     home.setLogoutHandler(() -> System.out.println("Logged out"));
Since:
2025-10-20
Version:
1.0.1
Author:
Abhinav, Avi, Bhavana, Ethan, Zayna

  • Constructor Details

    • HomeController

      public HomeController()
      Initializes all UI components, layouts, and event handlers.

      Creates the complete interface structure including split panes, tabs, buttons, and sets up all action listeners for drink selection, customization, and order management.

  • Method Details

    • setLogoutHandler

      public void setLogoutHandler(Runnable logoutHandler)
      Sets the logout handler callback to be invoked when user logs out.
      Parameters:
      logoutHandler - a Runnable to execute on logout

    • setEmployeeName

      public void setEmployeeName(String name)
      Sets the employee name displayed in the order interface.
      Parameters:
      name - the employee's name to display

    • setOrderHistory

      public void setOrderHistory(OrderHistoryController ordHistCont)
      Links this controller to an order history controller for synchronization.

      When orders are completed, the order history will be automatically refreshed.

      Parameters:
      ordHistCont - the OrderHistoryController to synchronize with

    • setDatabaseService

      public void setDatabaseService(DatabaseService db)
      Sets the database service for this controller.

      Initializes database connectivity, loads the next order number, and refreshes menu items from the database.

      Parameters:
      db - the DatabaseService instance to use
